intro: Claytonia ozarkensis, commonly known as the Ozark spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and streamside habitats, preferring well-drained, loamy soils. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and often covered in a waxy coating, while its stems are slender and branching. Claytonia ozarkensis is an important part of the native flora in its habitat, contributing to local biodiversity and ecological stability.
